about_the_game:
With the Himrrs, a special freight wagon is making its way into Train Simulator. At the late 1990s, the Himrrs was developed as a two-part sliding wall wagon, which is used in particular for transporting bulky but lightweight parts in the automotive industry. The reason for this is the large loading dimensions, which exceed the G2 standard – this means that the wagon can only be used on routes with special permits.

From 1998, the wagon developed by ADtranz was built in Hungary and then taken over by TRANSWAGGON GmbH. At DB, these were then classified as private wagons, easily recognisable by the "P" following running number. While the majority of the wagons have an unpainted aluminium shell, a handful were painted in bright yellow.

The virtual re-creation for Train Simulator awaits with a detailed model and high-resolution textures and inscriptions. Functional couplings, and an authentic soundscape round off the experience.

Included Scenarios

The Himrrs Freight Wagon Add-On includes 2 scenarios for the Bahnstrecke Strasbourg - Karlsruhe route:

  • Car Parts To Karlsruhe

  • Chassis To Kehl

More scenarios are available on the Steam Workshop online and in-game. Train Simulator’s Steam Workshop scenarios are free and easy to download, adding many more hours of exciting gameplay. With scenarios being added daily, why don’t you check it out now!

Key Features

  • Himrrs freight wagon in various versions

    • Silver XXL Lettering

    • Silver used

    • Yellow-Blue

    • Yellow-Blue used XXL Lettering

  • Highly detailed 3D model and textures

  • Authentic soundscape

  • Dynamic numbering

  • Working couplers (including sound)

  • QuickDrive Consists for the most common locomotives

  • 2 Scenarios included

  • Download size: 22.2 MB
